title.narrative: 002 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: 'Improved knowledge management through data generation that informs and strengthens service delivery, policies, procedures, monitoring and evaluation at the federal and regional levels., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2020, the Ethiopian population (including refugees and asylum seekers) in particular women, children, adolescent girls and vulnerable groups, use affordable, safe, reliable, sustainable and adequate water supply, sanitation and appropriate hygiene practices in households, communities and institutions in rural and urban areas

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'Improved knowledge management through data generation that informs and strengthens service delivery, policies, procedures,monitoring and evaluation at the federal and regional levels.

description.narrative: Hydrogeology Operational maps (1:50,000); Well site maps (1:10,000); Phase 2 final report maps and reports were published including terms of reference for drilling and supervision of 20 wells; project summary report; project dissemination flyer; webservice for easy access to all project data, maps and reports. Concept note for National water mapping of Ethiopia for Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM) and WASH as well as water well drilling site marking reports were also prepared. The maps and reports produced are for eight cluster areas with complete hydrogeological map, groundwater suitability map, hydrogeological operational map and target site drilling maps. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:24/08/2020
